title: Modern Sans Serif Suggestion
content:
I’m looking for a modern typeface (probably sans) that connotes performance, leadership and entrepreneurship; if it looked a little techy that wouldn’t be such a bad thing.

Right now, my closest faces are [Neo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415110), [Interface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/interface/corp) and [Foco](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco) ... [Trantino Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/books.google.com/books?id=OR-HKs4ZvrAC&pg=RA1-PA291&lpg=RA1-PA291&dq=trantino+bold&source=web&ots=l1KCGKtmJR&sig=kkgHX6BpZMYmBZ8kqnPep_3uexw) is close but looks a little dated, unoriginal.

Is there anything new or unexpected that someone can suggest.

It should be durable enough for web/motion graphics. This will be a brand’s primary typeface.

Thanks so much!

 [‹ gd ligature](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40168 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fuse Magazine and D&AD ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39718 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sam Serif

comments.content: I like Apex a lot, but it seems like it could have a little more personality and a stronger leadership quality.

Have you looked one of the “mothers” of all of these squarish look-a-like sans?

I am talking about DTL Argo.  
 [http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/ "http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/")
Of course, anything is going to look dated when the only text you have seen it in references the Mary Tyler Moore Show.
DTL Argo is nice. I can’t believe I hadn’t tried that yet.

“I can’t believe I hadn’t tried that yet.”

Did you check out the license prices?....

;)

Also by Gerard Unger, a similar sans: [Vesta](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.gerardunger.com/fontstore/store-vesta.html) might suit your purposes and be more affordable.

Oh yes, Vesta is also nice, and rather similar to Argo aswell.

I agree, DTL fonts are very expensive, but I cant help it – I just love the clean design of DTL Argo.

If you like Argo, you will like Stalemate by Stefan Hattenbach.  
 [http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/stalemate.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/stalemate.asp "http://www.fountain.nu/catalogue/stalemate.asp")

Klavika is great; thanks for the suggestion!

Cross: I actually have Argo at work, so that’s a lifesaver. I was actually pricing something from [TEFF](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.teff.nl/index-type.html) earlier ... and I almost fell out of my chair!

Vesta is nice but a little low key. Stalemate is great, plus I love [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012145244/http:/www.fountain.nu/). Can anyone think of one that would make a good brandmark (i.e. a little more distinction/personality) as well?
